name: OpenSea Data Query
title: OpenSea Data Query

api_list.name: [Deprecated] Retrieving orders
api_list.description: How to fetch orders from the OpenSea system.

api_list.name: Retrieve trait offers V2
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to get all trait offers for a specified collection.

api_list.name: Retrieve all listings V2
api_list.description: get all active listings for a collection

api_list.name: Get an NFT
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to fetch metadata, traits, ownership information, and rarity for an NFT

api_list.name: Retrieve listings V2
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to fetch the set of active listings on a given NFT for the Seaport contract.

api_list.name: Retrieve NFTs (by account)
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to fetch NFTs owned by a given account address

api_list.name: Retrieve NFTs (by contract)
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to fetch multiple NFTs for a smart contract

api_list.name: Retrieve NFTs (by collection)
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to fetch multiple NFTs for a collection

api_list.name: Retrieve collection offers V2
api_list.description: This endpoint is used to get collection offers for a specified collection.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com/v2/offers/collection/ongakucraft"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com/v2/offers/collection/{slug}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Account
api_list.description: Get an OpenSea Account Profile including details such as bio, social media usernames, and profile image.

api_list.name: Retrieving a collection
api_list.description: Used for retrieving more in-depth information about individual collections, including real time statistics like floor price.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/collection/ongakucraft"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieving collection stats
api_list.description: Use this endpoint to fetch stats for a specific collection, including realtime floor price statistics

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

api_list.name: Retrieving bundles
api_list.description: Bundles are groups of items for sale on OpenSea. You can buy them all at once in one transaction, and you can create them without any transactions or gas, as long as you've already approved the assets inside.

api_list.name: Retrieving collections
api_list.description:
The `/collections` endpoint provides a list of all the collections supported and vetted by OpenSea. To include all collections relevant to a user (including non-whitelisted ones), set the owner param.

Each collection in the returned area has an attribute called primary_asset_contracts with info about the smart contracts belonging to that collection. For example, ERC-1155 contracts maybe have multiple collections all referencing the same contract, but many ERC-721 contracts may all belong to the same collection (dapp).

You can also use this endpoint to find which dapps an account uses, and how many items they own in each - all in one API call!

api_list.name: Retrieving assets
api_list.description:
To retrieve assets from our API, call the `/assets` endpoint with the desired filter parameters.

Auctions created on OpenSea don't use an escrow contract, which enables gas-free auctions and allows users to retain ownership of their items while they're on sale. So this is just a heads up in case you notice some assets from opensea.io not appearing in the API.

api_list.name: Retrieving a contract
api_list.description: Used to fetch more in-depth information about an contract asset.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/asset_contract/0x4372f4d950d30c6f12c7228ade77d6cc019404c9"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com/api/v1/asset_contract/{asset_contract_address}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "opensea-data-query.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieving events
api_list.description: The `/events` endpoint provides a list of events that occur on the assets that OpenSea tracks. The "event_type" field indicates what type of event it is (transfer, successful auction, etc).
